definition: the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
surname Su/abbr. for Soviet Union 蘇維埃|苏维埃 or 蘇聯|苏联/abbr. for Jiangsu province 江蘇|江苏/abbr. for Suzhou city 蘇州|苏州
Perilla frutescens (Chinese basil or wild red basil)/place name/to revive/used as phonetic in transliteration

sentences.english: Nor would we undertake an obligation to concert US-Soviet actions toward third countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们也不承担协调美苏针对第三国行动的义务。

sentences.english: The Cold War was also a sporting war, with US–Soviet rivalries played out every four years.
sentences.chinese: 冷战也体现在体育对抗上，每四年演绎一场美苏对抗。

sentences.english: Never mind the two-party U.S.-Soviet moon race of old.
sentences.chinese: 忘记以前登月竞赛的美苏争霸吧。

sentences.english: The American and Soviet governments drew diametrically opposite conclusions from it.
sentences.chinese: 美苏两国政府从这里得出了截然相反的结论。

sentences.english: This had a far-reaching effects on pattern of US-Soviet Cold War and the situation in the Middle East.
sentences.chinese: 这对美苏冷战格局和中东局势都产生了深远影响。

sentences.english: If a nuclear exchange began, children were to crouch beneath their desks.
sentences.chinese: 如果美苏开始相互核攻击，孩子们就要蹲到课桌下面。

sentences.english: The U.S. and the Soviet bloc exchanged accused spies at the Glienicke Bridge in a deal that eventually involved 29 people.
sentences.chinese: 美苏在Glienicke桥互换了29名间谍。

sentences.english: This marks the US-Soviet relations have entered a new stage.
sentences.chinese: 这标志着美苏关系进入一个新阶段。

sentences.english: Imagine a US-China renewable energy initiative, along the lines of the US-Soviet space station.
sentences.chinese: 试着沿美苏空间站的思路想象美中可再生能源倡议。

sentences.english: On the Impact of Vietnam War on American Economy;
sentences.chinese: 美苏两强一个台前，一个幕后都卷入了越南战争。

sentences.english: Conservatives resented the very fact of a Soviet-American dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 保守派人士对于美苏对话这件事大为不满。

sentences.english: Both two powers U S and USSR were involved in the Vietnamese War directly or indirectly.
sentences.chinese: 美苏两强一个台前，一个幕后都卷入了越南战争。

sentences.english: From this perspective, the US-Soviet detente is based on the realities of the nuclear age.
sentences.chinese: 从这个角度看，美苏缓和正是基于核时代的现实。

sentences.english: Before the war, China is the United States and Soviet Union countries want to fight.
sentences.chinese: 开战前，中国是美苏都想争取的国家。

sentences.english: Germany's effect in Cold War was reduced under the situation which the US-Soviet relations relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 在美苏关系缓和的形势下，德国在冷战中的作用降低。

definition: Soviet Union, 1922-1991/abbr. for Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR) 蘇維埃社會主義共和國聯盟|苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟[Su1 wei2 ai1 She4 hui4 zhu3 yi4 Gong4 he2 guo2 Lian2 meng2]
